org.gridgain.grid.spi.cloud
Interface GridCloudSpi

All Superinterfaces:
GridSpi
All Known Implementing Classes:
GridEc2LiteCloudSpi, GridJvmCloudSpi
public interface GridCloudSpi
extends GridSpi

Cloud SPI provides ability to manage cloud providers in a uniform fashion. GridGain supports multiple cloud SPIs, where each particular SPI implementation can represent different cloud provider or different configurations for the same cloud provider.

Cloud SPIs get activated only on coordinator nodes. Coordinator node acts as a gateway to all clouds it has SPIs configured for. All interaction with its clouds happens only through coordinator node. If GridConfiguration.isDisableCloudCoordinator() is set to true then a node cannot be a cloud coordinator. Cloud SPI gets deactivated when the coordinator node leaves the topology. Note that deactivation is not guaranteed when coordinator node exits abnormally. Since coordinator node can leave the topology, the SPI can "migrate" from one node to another (i.e. from one coordinator to another) via a sequence of deactivation on one node and activation on another.

SPI only becomes enabled when it is activated. This is a special behavior for that SPI - all other SPIs in GridGain become enabled just upon creation without special lifecycle. Implementations of this SPI should pay special attention to that fact.

Once activated the SPI deals with three main entities:

  • GridCloudCommand - object that encapsulates the user command to be performed on the cloud.
  • GridCloudSpiSnapshot - the snapshot of the cloud's state. This state get exchanged between nodes.
  • GridCloudResource - object that represents an individual resource in the cloud.
GridGain provides the following GridCloudSpi implementations:
  • GridJvmCloudSpi
  • GridEc2LiteCloudSpi
  • GridRackspaceCloudSpi in Enterprise Edition only

compare

Collection<GridTuple2<GridCloudResource,GridCloudSpiResourceAction>> compare(GridCloudSpiSnapshot oldSnp,
                                                                             GridCloudSpiSnapshot newSnp)
Compares two snapshots and return delta (potentially empty but never null).

Parameters:
oldSnp - Old snapshot.
newSnp - New snapshot.
Returns:
Difference between snapshots. This method never returns null but may return an empty collection if snapshots are identical.
